intro: Rhaphiolepis deflexa, commonly known as the Chinese holly or redleaf holly, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to China and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are leathery and glossy, providing year-round visual interest, while its berries are red and ornamental. Rhaphiolepis deflexa is valued in horticulture for its hardiness and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
